creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: two groups of women in foreground washing clothing along the banks of a quiet river; boats parked at bank of opposite shore; short, steep bank behind boats leading up to large two-story temple gate; cluster of buildings on L and trees on R of gate
marks: left, cursive jizuri: 自摺　昭和拾二年作　大同門 {jizuri, Shōwa LLC: よし田 {Yoshida}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Daedong Gate
